gauzy: A gauzy pattern is typically a lightweight, sheer fabric with a lot of texture.
A "gauzy" thing looks like a piece of thin, translucent fabric.
meshed: A meshed object has a three-dimensional surface made up of closely spaced, interconnected triangles.
A meshed surface is a surface that has been divided into a regular grid of small polygons.
cracked: A cracked surface may have a large or small crack running through it.
Cracked material looks like it has been split or broken into multiple pieces.
stratified: A "stratified" thing looks like it is made up of different layers.
Stone that has been split into thin, parallel layers.
scaly: Scaly material has a rough, dry texture and can flake off in scales.
A scaly texture has a small, rough surface.
swirly: A "swirly" texture usually looks like a spiral or a whirlpool.
A "swirly" pattern often looks like a spiral.
perforated: Perforated material has small holes spread evenly throughout the material.
A perforated object has small holes punched through it.
pleated: A pleated texture has a series of folds or creases.
A pleated surface is one that has been folded or creased so that it contains a series of parallel folds.
flecked: A flecked surface has small pieces of another material mixed in with it.
A "flecked" texture looks like a small speckled or dotted pattern.
fibrous: A fibrous surface is covered in tiny fibers.
A fibrous thing can look like a string or a rope.
polka-dotted: A polka-dotted thing looks like it has small, round dots all over it.
A polka-dotted texture describes a pattern of small, round dots that are evenly spaced across a surface.
chequered: "Chequered" material typically has a pattern of alternating light and dark squares, similar to a checkerboard.
One popular checkered pattern is built up of squares, with alternating light and dark colors.
blotchy: A "blotchy" thing is usually an irregular shape with dark and light areas.
There is no definitive answer to this question since the word "blotchy" is subjective.
stained: Stained things look like they have had something spilled on them and it has left a mark.
When something is stained, it is usually discolored from something else that has gotten on it.
crystalline: A crystalline object is one that has a very symmetrical, ordered structure.
A crystalline surface is one that is smooth and made up of small, regular crystals.
porous: A "porous" texture has small holes or pores that allow liquid or gas to pass through.
A porous thing can have small holes or be permeable to fluids and gases.
banded: A banded object has stripes or bands of color.
A banded texture is characterized by stripes or bands of color.
lacelike: A lacelike material looks like a piece of lace.
A lacelike surface is one that is covered in a pattern of small holes, like a piece of lace.
sprinkled: A "sprinkled" pattern generally looks like a light, uniform dusting of something over a surface.
A sprinkling of materials looks like a light dusting or covering.
bubbly: A "bubbly" surface is covered in small, round bumps.
A "bubbly" object has a lot of small bubbles on its surface.
lined: A lined object has a defined edge or border.
Lined materials have a second layer of fabric sewn on the inside of the garment.
veined: Veined materials have lines or streaks running through them.
A veined texture is one with visible lines or streaks running through it.
bumpy: A "bumpy" pattern looks like a series of peaks and valleys.
Bumpy material typically has an irregular surface with raised areas.
paisley: A "paisley" surface looks like an intricate, curved design that is often used in fabrics and wallpapers.
A paisley pattern is a print with a curved, teardrop-shaped motif.
potholed: Potholed material generally looks like abroken-up road.
A potholed pattern is one where the prices make a series of lower highs and lower lows, and the lows are getting progressively lower.
waffled: Waffled textures are usually bumpy or ridged.
A waffled pattern looks like a honeycomb or waffle iron.
pitted: A pitted object is one that has small craters or holes on its surface.
A pitted object is one that has small craters or holes on its surface.
frilly: A "frilly" surface is one that is covered with a lot of small, decorative details.
A "frilly" texture often looks like it has a lot of small wrinkles or creases in it.
spiralled: A spiralled texture looks like a spiral or a coil.

knitted: A "knitted" texture looks like a series of small loops that are interlocked together.
Knitted fabric is created by interlocking loops of yarn.
grooved: A grooved object looks like an object that has a line or a crease running down the middle of it.

dotted: Dotted material has small, raised dots on the surface.

interlaced: Interlaced material is a type of digital video that appears to have scan lines.
An interlaced object has a pattern of over-and-under weaving.
crosshatched: A crosshatched surface is a surface that has been covered with a series of crossed lines.
If something is crosshatched, it is marked with a series of lines that intersect each other.
wrinkled: A wrinkled object has many small folds or creases in it.

smeared: "Smeared" material can look like streaks or smudges on a surface.

striped: A striped pattern typically consists of repeated, regular lines that run perpendicular to each other.
A striped texture has vertical lines running through it.
braided: Braided material is made up of three or more strands of fabric that have been braided together.
A braid is a complex structure made of three or more strands of hair, fabric, or other material interwoven together.
freckled: A freckled object has spots or patches of color that are spread over its surface.
A "freckled" pattern looks like a series of small, dark spots on a light background.
cobwebbed: The word "cobwebbed" is often used to describe a material that is covered in dust or small particles.
"Cobwebbed" material is usually covered in a layer of dust or spider webs.
honeycombed: A honeycomb texture is defined by a series of hexagonal shapes.
A honeycombed object has a series of hexagonal or round cavities.
woven: A woven surface is a textured surface that simulates the appearance of fabric.
A woven object looks like a piece of fabric that has been created by interlocking pieces of thread or yarn.
matted: The word "matted" is often used to describe hair that is tangled and unkempt.
A "matted" thing looks like it has a lot of tangled hair.
zigzagged: "Zigzagged" material is characterized by its sharp, angular corners.
Zigzagged material is material that has been folded or cut into a series of parallel lines that alternate between going in one direction and then going in the opposite direction.
marbled: Marbled material typically has a swirled or mottled appearance, as if different colors or types of material have been combined together.
Marbling is a pattern with swirls or streaks of color.
studded: A "studded" thing is covered in small, decorative metal studs.
A studded thing has small, metal protrusions sticking out of it.
grid: A "grid" thing can look like a lot of different things.
A "grid" object is a two-dimensional array of numbers, usually used to represent a map or board.
